title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Eternity' featuring Elizabeth Olsen and Miles Teller streams on Apple TV, exploring afterlife relationships.
'Dawson's Creek' streams on Netflix, Hulu, and Tubi, honoring late actor James Van Der Beek.
'Love Is Blind' Season 10 streams on Netflix, following couples forged in blind speed dating.

title: Court says Mass. father’s battle over LGBTQ-friendly lessons excludes books on gender stereotypes
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Lexington father, Alan L., sues over LGBTQ-friendly classroom lessons, citing conflict with Christian values.
Judge F. Dennis Saylor IV rules 'gender stereotype' books do not fall under injunction to exclude materials.
Alan L.'s case claims constitutional right to direct child's education; lawsuit remains pending in court.

title: Roman Anthony set to join Team USA for World Baseball Classic if he passes physical
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Roman Anthony, 21, could join Team USA for the World Baseball Classic pending a successful physical exam.
Anthony replaces Corbin Carroll due to injury, making him the youngest player on Team USA.
Anthony hit .292 with .859 OPS in MLB last season; would join outfielders Aaron Judge and Byron Buxton.

title: $20M penthouse at Taylor Swift’s rumored wedding venue hits market
author: Regina Cole
bullets: A $20 million penthouse at Ocean House in Westerly, Rhode Island is now for sale.
The 4,696 sq. ft. unit offers ocean views, a 2,400 sq. ft. terrace, three bedrooms, and four bathrooms.
Owners gain access to the hotel's amenities, including a private beach, gym, and dining options.

title: 10 Celtics stats that should show encouragement and discouragement entering All-Star break
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Boston Celtics are second in the Eastern Conference with a 35-19 record entering the All-Star break.
The team's top lineup boasts a 16.8 net rating, significantly improved from last season's most-used lineup.
Celtics have struggled in clutch games with a 12-14 record, ranking 21st among all NBA teams.

title: Your Cape Cod winter guide: 20 things to do during the cold months
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Cape Cod offers year-round attractions like museums, including the Sandwich Glass Museum, John F. Kennedy Hyannis Museum, and Cape Cod Museum of Art.
Outdoor activities in winter include beach walks, hikes on the Cape Cod Rail Trail, and snowshoeing at Nickerson State Park.
Visitors can enjoy dining at Bamboo Chinese Cuisine, wine tastings at Truro Vineyards, and local theater at Cape Cod Theatre Company.

title: She’s running Boston for people like her with Type 1 Diabetes
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Kristine Lapczynski, 30, will run the 2026 Boston Marathon for Breakthrough T1D, supporting Type 1 Diabetes research.
Lapczynski, a pharmacist from Fuquay-Varina, NC, attended MCPHS University in Boston where she developed her passion for running.
Diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes for 23 years, she is running to inspire her daughter and support her mother recently diagnosed with T1D.

title: She picked up running at age 45. Now at 61, she’s on track for her Six Star medal.
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Andrea Nwamarah, 61, began running at age 45 and is aiming for her Six Star medal at the Boston Marathon.
Nwamarah, from Simpsonville, SC, is running for the MEB Foundation, supporting youth health and leadership.
The MEB Foundation marathon entry allows Nwamarah to run the prestigious Boston Marathon, her Sixth Star pursuit.

title: Boston Marathon runner inspired by aunt’s blindness raises money for the visually impaired
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Paige Stopperich, 29, from Somerville, will run the 2026 Boston Marathon for her aunt who lost her vision.
Stopperich is participating in the marathon to support the Massachusetts Association for the Blind and Visually Impaired.
The Massachusetts Association for the Blind offers vital services like assistive technology and mobility training to the visually impaired.

title: Drake Maye says he doesn’t regret marrying young. What readers said.
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Drake Maye, 23, quarterback of the New England Patriots, praises his decision to marry young, citing personal fulfillment.
Boston.com readers share mixed experiences on marrying young, ranging from regret to longstanding, successful relationships.
Reader feedback highlights diverse outcomes of early marriage, noting stability and challenges in sustaining long-term partnerships.
